page.title: 14NOTTINGHAM - THE CORNER SHOP
page.content: There are two corner shops near where I live.The people who own the shops are kind and generous.If you try to compare a corner shop with a supermarket, you'll find that a supermarket is miles bigger.When I go in the shop, I hear them talking in an Indian language which I don't understand, so I can't listen in on their conversations.Of course,there's always the other corner shop to listen in on.One of the shops smells of all sorts of things. I go to the corner shop for milk, teabags and things like that, but I especially go there for sweets.I just love sweets.I can't part with them.I have to have them every minute of the day.Some of the most perculiar people go into the shops.All they want to buy is drink.
